onlineAddresses.caption: CoinDesk: This Mila Kunis-Backed TV Show Lets NFT Holders Choose the Plot

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Mila Kunis has established herself as one of Hollywood’s most sought after, vivacious and engaging actresses.
  • Mila Kunis was honored as one of People Magazine's People of the Year for using her platform to deliver aid to people in her birth country of Ukraine and raising $37 million for refugees in need.
  • Kunis started her production company called Orchard Farm Productions with Susan Curtis, Cameron Curtis, and Lisa Sterbakov.
  • She also co-founded 6th Wall, a blockchain entertainment company behind the animated adult series, The Gimmicks, which allows owners of the show's NFT to choose the plot in a “choose your own adventure” mode.
  • Kunis is best known for her roles on two of Fox’s most successful shows: That 70’s Show and the Emmy-nominated Family Guy.
  • She starred opposite Natalie Portman in the Golden Globe and Oscar-nominated drama Black Swan, for which she was nominated for Best Supporting Actress at the SAG, Golden Globe, and Critics Choice Awards.
  • Kunis’ other notable film credits include The Spy Who Dumped Me, Bad Moms, Bad Moms Christmas, Jupiter Ascending, Oz, The Great and Powerful, Ted, Friends with Benefits, Date Night, The Book of Eli, Extract, Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Blood Ties, Angriest Man in Brooklyn, Max Payne, Third Person, and Hell and Back.

speakerBiography.text:
Mila Kunis has established herself as one of Hollywood’s most sought after, vivacious and engaging actresses. Since beginning her career in acting, she has garnered an impressive body of work that includes both major motion picture and television roles. 

In 2015, Kunis started her production company called Orchard Farm Productions with Susan Curtis, Cameron Curtis, and Lisa Sterbakov. The company later teamed up with Lindsey McInerney to launch 6th Wall, a blockchain entertainment company that serves as its digital arm. 6th Wall is behind the animated adult series, The Gimmicks, which allows owners of the show's NFT to choose the plot in a “choose your own adventure” mode.

Kunis is best known for her roles on two of Fox’s most successful shows: That 70’s Show and the animated Emmy nominated show Family Guy. On That 70’s Show, she played "Jackie Burkhart," which earned her two Young Star Awards for Best Actress in a Television Series. She is still currently the voice of "Meg" on Family Guy.

Kunis stars in AGC Studios’ Breaking News In Yuba County, opposite Allison Janney, Awkwafina, and Regina Hall. The movie follows a woman who buries her husbands’ body after he passes and takes advantage of her newfound celebrity status from having a missing husband. Jake Gyllenhall and Riva Marker are producing the film.

She appeared in Rodrigo Garcia’s substance abuse drama Four Good Days opposite Glenn Close. In 2018, she appeared in Lionsgate comedy, The Spy Who Dumped Me, alongside Kate McKinnon. Kunis also can be seen in the STX hit comedy Bad Moms opposite Kristen Bell, Christina Applegate, Kathryn Hahn, and Jada Pinkett Smith. She then went on to star in the much-anticipated sequel, Bad Moms Christmas, which was released in November 2017.

In 2010 Kunis starred as "Lilly" opposite Natalie Portman in the critically acclaimed Golden Globe and Oscar-nominated supernatural drama Black Swan directed by Darren Aronofsky from Fox Searchlight. Kunis was awarded the Marcello Mastroianni Award for Best Young Actress for her performance in Black Swan at the 2010 Venice Film Festival. Kunis was also nominated for Best Supporting Actress for her performance at the 2011 SAG, Golden Globe, and Critics Choice Awards.

Kunis’s other notable film credits include Jupiter Ascending, Oz, The Great and Powerful, Ted, Friends with Benefits, Date Night, The Book of Eli, Extract, Forgetting Sarah Marshall, Blood Ties, Angriest Man in Brooklyn, Max Payne, Third Person, and Hell and Back.

speakerNameSubheading.text: Award-Winning Actress & Founder of Orchard Farm Productions
